intro: Carduus hsiaowutaishanensis, commonly known as the Xiaowutaishan thistle, is a flowering plant species native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are spiny and lobed, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. This species is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
